column4: I installed a webserver on ubuntu and I copied index files etc to /etc/www. so I can access the webpage by typing the IP address of the server in my browser (http://192.168.x.x), and my computer and server are in the same network. How can I access to the webserver in another network, http://real.ip:port?
ypu mean you copied them to /var/www?
if you mean you want people on the internet to be able to see your pages, you need a portforwarding from port 80 of your router to your machine
what setting?
login to yout router and look for something called portforwarding, virtuell server. Depenfs on the type of router you have
it depends on the board
for arduino: just connect it and chosse the correct tty
I use beaglebone that runs ubuntu-arm
http://blog.makezine.com/2012/03/14/how-to-get-started-with-the-beaglebone/
Sure its ttyUSB1
can't you connect your board over ethernet?
http://beagleboard.org/static/beaglebone/latest/README.htm
the eth interface does not work that's why I am trying to connect through the usb. thanks for your suggestion
which command?
I still don't see a command
thats a name of a device but not a command
paste ls -l /dev/ttyUSB1
add your user to the dialout group
it is my stupidness that I did not put "screen" in front of the command. Thanks a lot for your help
so it works now?
yes it works now thanks a lot
it's apparently the same setup
you're welcome
